phrases: Hey, so I totally forgot to give this to your mom on New Year's Day...
I was so worked up that day...
Why do not you come over?
I think she would be happy to get it from you personally.
I was like this when I had you, too.
I will go buy some rice.
Wait, how much are you going to buy?
The men in this home are such worrywarts.
Maybe I should show him my prenatal checkup notes.
I would love to become a strong mother like you someday.
Men are such wimps, women have to be the strong ones.
we were waiting for the kindergarten bus,
and the idiot jumped into the street.
I instinctively got Take out of there,
And this is the boy who got bruises
and bled from cuts every day, without making a single fuss.
Then, from the start, Takeo-kun was caring!
He must care a lot about his mom.
So he is a mommy's boy to boot.
Men can be weak in surprising ways.
everyone in the delivery room clapped and cheered.
They seem to be having fun.
When I brought him in for his one-month checkup,
the nurse raised Takeo over her head and said, The yokozuna's here.
How much rice did you buy?
I thought we should stock up.
Did you use all the money in my wallet?!
Well, I will be off to the hospital for my checkup.
Takeo-kun, when you were born, you weighed 4,300 grams.
I was a preemie, so I was fewer than 2,000 grams.
For a long time, I was in this transparent case...
I was so small, I could not leave the hospital with Mom.
I am looking forward to meeting the new baby.
I am anemic again, so I was asked to come in...
We wanted our second child sooner,
but now he is much older...
I am glad you got your wish.
Your big brother's waiting for you.
How did it go at the hospital?
When Yamato was born, she was half my weight.
She told me she could not go home with her mom.
there is not a guarantee that babies born into this world will live to grow up.
Honey, I will clean the bathtub.
Yamato Rinko Subject: Me at 100 Days
I am glad she grew up.
I was born larger than most,
and I never really got sick growing up.
I had not thought very much about it before.
But I guess that is not always the case...
Let me carry that for you.
Having a caring friend like you
That is because he is a good man.
To me, he is still a little boy.
I hope this one will make good friends, too...
She put it on the bag she takes everywhere.
I hope I can meet the baby soon.
I want to see your 100-day baby pictures, too.
This posture is supposed to be good, for ensuring a safe delivery.
Maybe so, but are not you doing that too fast?
That was a real strong kick.
This one will be really healthy.
Honey, I will go clean the bath
Wait, where do you think you are going?
I am just taking a walk.
It is better to walk around a lot, so the baby will be healthy.
At our ages, if we all take a walk together, it would be too embarrassing.
Takeo, do you know why I married your mom?
Well, she and I began working at the company at the same time.
Your mom had this presence, even as a new employee.
She worked very hard, so her supervisor looked after her,
and all the other female employees looked up to her...
That year, at the end-of-the-year party...
Takenaka-san, please pass that pot around.
I will go wash my hand.
I am wearing a lot of layers, so it is fine.
Would you like me to bring some ice?
When I see cute girls like her,
I just want to protect them, you know?
That was the first time in my life,
I thought I would want to ride out the turbulent waves of life with someone like her!
Would you like to play golf with me?
Let us go for a drive.
I want to protect you, Takenaka-san.
I have never gotten around to protecting her.
Gouda-san, you have another checkup tomorrow, do not you?
We are both due soon, are not we?
I am fine, I am fine...
You do not know if it is a boy or a girl yet?
I cannot really imagine a girl...
I can only think of the kid with your face.
You are right, I can only think of one face.
Suna, you are laughing too much!
Mom's going to the hospital for a bit.
I heard a really loud noise.
I should have just called one.
I have to keep it together.
Please go to Shisuda General Hospital.
Take, I left my wallet at home
I have paid for the taxi.
You have a good head on your shoulders, Makoto-kun.
My goodness, I wish he would calm down a little.
That is why he is a good man.
You are too nice to Takeo...
She is always been healthy, so...
I have never seen her like this.
Oh, Take, did you bring my wallet?
I am going to be hospitalized.
I want you to do a couple things, so write them down.
In my room, there is a bag I put together for the hospital stay.
Oh, and do not forget to wash the dishes and do the laundry.
Tomorrow's flammables, so take out the trash.
I am fine, so do not worry.
I will take you to your room.
I will go drop this off!
Oh, the doctor is seeing your wife.
I have to keep it together.
Takeo-kun, you are not peeling the vegetables?
Oh, is it like a macrobiotic thing?!
I like making curry on the sweet side.
Ha ha, you make a lot of bubbles when you wash dishes!
You are using way too much detergent.
Oh, you do not have to walk me home.
If you need any help, call me.
You went by the hospital, right?
How was my brother or sister?
On your way back from school tomorrow, stop by the hospital.
I am glad you were here!
I know another mother who is expecting, due around the same time as I am.
When she tripped and I turned to catch her,
I felt a pain in my stomach.
I just could not help myself.
I wonder if our baby's mad at me for that...
You wanted to protect them both.
Let us have one of you read the page.
I have to keep it together!
Yamato Rinko Subject: Still have curry?
Can I come over today, too?
I am going to the hospital.
Sorry, we ate all the curry.
Mom would be happy to see you.
I have to keep it together!
Do not you have to stay lying down?
Hey, I am not some invalid.
Anything you want me to do?
But does not she look pale?
I do not really know anything about this,
but a human being's going to pop out of another person.
Is not that a big deal?
Hey, it is not over yet.
Man, you are so strong, Mom!
Is not there something I can do?
I am right here with you!
Her room's on the second floor, right?
I am not a kid anymore.
It is Mom and the baby who are having to tough it out.
I am going to go cheer on my mom a bit!
Suna and Yamato have come to see you
Take, use the intercom to call the nurse...
I have let the contractions go on too long.
What can I help you with?
Mom, it is going to be okay!
She cannot walk, so please bring a wheelchair.
I am sorry, I need a wheelchair, too...
Please take the lady next to me first.
It is her first birth, and she is scared.
Are you going to be okay?
It is going to be okay.
Your brother's friend and girlfriend want to meet you.
Your dad and mom are waiting for you, too.
You can feel safe coming out.
my baby was born safely yesterday!
I hope our children can become friends.
Take, please bring my black bag.
Okay, I will go push one out now.
She is a beautiful baby girl, at 4,200 grams!
Sir, your wife did really well.
She is almost twice as big as the other babies, though.
It is my first time seeing a real newborn!
I would be okay with her marrying you.
The age difference is too great..
I was born healthier than most,
and grew up bigger than most.
Someday, I would like to have a job helping other people.
I never would have thought that Takeo would carry me like a princess one day.
I have been thinking of him as a little boy,
but he is all grown up...
Let us raise another one together.
I love Yamato when she is holding a baby.
I want to become a kindergarten teacher or a midwife.
That would be two totally different tracks in college, though.
I wonder what your little sister will call you.
I am sure it will just be Takeo.
That is what everyone calls you.
